H0.text: Throw the cans in the trash is what Carmine's mother should do after drinking four cans of soft drink each day.

H1.text: Sending the cans to a landfill is what Carmine's mother should do after she drinks four cans of soft drink each day.

H2.text: Taking the cans to be recycled is what Carmine's mother should do after drinking the four cans of soft drink each day.

H3.text: Crushing the cans before putting them in the trash is what Carmine's mother should do after drinking four cans of soft drink each day.

A4.text: Journalist John Tierney notes that it is generally more expensive for municipalities to recycle waste from households than to send it to a landfill and that 'recycling may be the most wasteful activity in modern America.'

A5.text: However, a 2004 assessment by the Danish Environmental Assessment Institute concluded that incineration was the most effective method for disposing of drink containers, even aluminium ones.

A6.text: It is estimated that Americans throw away nearly 1 billion dollars a year in wasted aluminum.

A7.text: The aluminum can is also considered the most valuable recyclable material in an average recycling bin.

A8.text: The city's Department of the Environment's Zero Waste Program has led the city to achieve 80% diversion, the highest diversion rate in North America.

A9.text: The city's 'Pay-As-You-Throw' system charges customers by the volume of landfill-bound materials, which provides a financial incentive to separate recyclables and compostables from other discards.
